summary: Creates an instantaneous quantum polynomial (IQP) circuit whose gate layout consists of an initial layer of Hadamard gates, a diagonal layer of T‑gate rotations, a set of controlled‑phase (CS) gates determined by the upper‑triangular part of an interaction matrix, and a final layer of Hadamards. The matrix entries directly set the rotation exponents, allowing the circuit to be instantiated from any n × n interaction matrix.
business_intent: Enable users to generate standard IQP circuits for research on commuting quantum computations, complexity analysis, and benchmarking of quantum simulators within the Qiskit framework.
